Class CPDTreeBuilder

extends java.lang.Object
    Used for creating a new CPDTree object

    Matthew Bernstein - matthewb@cs.wisc.edu

    • Method Detail

      • buildCPDTree

        public CPDTree buildCPDTree(DataSet data,
                   java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> cpdAttrs,
                   java.lang.Integer laplaceCount)
        Build a CPD tree
        Parameters:
        data - the data set used to construct the tree
        cpdAttrs - the attributes in the CPD tree
        laplaceCount - the Laplace count used when calculating each probability
        Returns:
        the constructed CPD tree

      • makeSubTree

        private CPDNode makeSubTree(DataSet data,
                  Attribute attribute,
                  java.lang.Integer value,
                  java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> availAttributes,
                  java.lang.Integer laplaceCount)
        A recursive method that returns a subtree of the CPD tree rooted at a specific attribute.
        Parameters:
        data - - a data set of training instances that will be used to construct the subtree
        attribute - - the attribute that the root node should test
        relation - - how an instances attribute is compared to the root node's value. See for valid relations
        availAttributes - - a list of available attributes that are available to split the training instances
        Returns:
        the root of the subtree

      • checkStoppingCriteria

        private java.lang.Boolean checkStoppingCriteria(DataSet data,
                                      java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> availableAttributes)
        Check for the tree stopping criteria given a data set of instances. The stopping criteria is achieved if one of the following holds true: 1. There are no more available attributes to split on 2. The number of instances at the node is zero
        Parameters:
        data - - a data set that holds a subset of the training set
        minInstances - - if the number of instances in the data set at the current node is less than or equal to the this argument, than the stopping criteria has been reached
        Returns:
        true if the stopping criteria has been met, false otherwise

      • removeAttributeById

        private java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> removeAttributeById(java.util.ArrayList<Attribute> currAttributes,
                                                 java.lang.Integer attrId)
        A helper method for removing an attribute with a specific attribute ID from an ArrayList of Attributes
        Parameters:
        currAttributes - ArrayList of Attributes from which we wish to remove an Attribute
        attrId - the ID of the Attribute we wish to remove
        Returns:
        the resultant Attributes
